intro: Terebinthus biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered terebinth, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, adapted to the dry conditions of its natural habitat. Terebinthus biflora is often found in rocky or coastal areas where it thrives in well-drained soils.
